name: Kerr-Taub-NUT spacetime metric
description: The Kerr-Taub-NUT metric is a solution to the Einstein field equations that describes the spacetime around a rotating, uncharged, massless, and nut-free black hole. It is a generalization of the Kerr metric, which includes the effects of rotation and electric charge, and the Taub-NUT metric, which includes the effects of nut charge. The metric is a solution to the Einstein field equations for a spacetime with a non-vanishing cosmological constant.
